question: Three main components of an x-ray imaging system are?
answer: X-ray tube, Operating Console and High Voltage Generator

Filament Transformer
Will terminate an exposure after a prescribed time, usually approximately 6 .
The timer circuit is separate from the other main circuits of the x-ray imaging system.It consists of an electronic device whose action is to ____ and ____ to high voltage across the x-ray tube.
Most exposure timers are electronic and are controlled by a ?
There are how many types of timing circuits? Three are controlled by radiologic technologists , and one is automatic.

A special type of electric motor. It is a precision device designed to drive a shaft at precisely 60 revolutions per second (rps). In some imaging systems , it is used as timing mechanism. It cannot be used for serial exposures becausee they must be reset after exposure.

X-ray imaging systems with this timers are recognizable because the minimum exposure time possible is 1/60 s (17 ms) , and timing intervals increase by multiples thereof, such as, 1/30, 1/20 , and so on.

It is the most sophisticated and most complicated ,and most accurate of the x-ray exposure timers. It consist of rather complex circuitry based on the time required to charge a capacitor through a variable resistance.

This timing circuit allow a wide range of time intervals to be selected and are accurate to intervals as small as 1 ms . Because they can be used for rapid serial exposure, they are suitable for interventional radiology procedures.
Terminates the x-ray exposure at the desired film optical density. This is done with an ionization chamber or a photodiode detector assembly.
A special kind of electronic timer monitors the product of mA and exposure time and terminates exposure when the desired mAs value is attained.

This timing circuit is usually designed to provide the highest safe tube current for the shortest exposure for any mAs selected. Because it must monitor the actual tube current , it is located on the secondary side of the high-voltage transformer.
Used on falling-load and capacitor discharge imaging systems.
Device that measures the quantity of radiation that reaches the image receptor. It automatically terminates the exposure when the image receptor has received the required radiation intensity.
The type of AEC used by most manufacturers incorporates are?
answer: Flat, parallel plate ionization chamber positioned b/w the px and image receptor

question: Most xray imaging systems are designed to operate on 220 volt although some can operate on what?

The autotransformer operates as an induction device the voltage it receives ( the primary voltage) and the voltage it provides (the secondary voltage) are related to what?
answer: Directly to the number of turns of the transformer enclosed by the respective connections

question: What kind of kVp meter registers even though no exposure is being made and the circuit has no current?
answer: Prereading kVp meter. It allows voltage to be monitored before an exposure

question: What is the full name of a filament transformer?
answer: Filament heating isolation step down transformer
